title: 20.2 A Recursive Structure
content:
Section 20.2

A Recursive Structure

Summary

Proto van Emde Boas structure with recursive √u clusters.

Key Points

  • Divide universe into √u clusters of √u elements each
  • summary structure: which clusters are non-empty
  • high(x) = ⌊x/√u⌋ determines cluster
  • low(x) = x mod √u determines position in cluster
  • Recurrence: T(u) = T(√u) + O(1) → T(u) = O(log log u)

Example

INSERT(5) into u=16: cluster = high(5) = 1, position = low(5) = 1. Insert into cluster[1] and update summary.

Why It Matters

Key recursive decomposition that achieves log log u.
